$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 3a. Procedure for Hf(OTf)4-Catalyzed
Thioacetalization: A mixture of carbonyl compounds (aldehydes or ketones,
1a-v, 1.0 mmol), monothiols (ethanethiol or benzenethiol, 2a-2b, 2.0
mmol) or dithiols (1,2-ethanedithiol or 1,3-propanedithiol, 2c-2d, 1.0
mmol), and a small catalytic amount of hafnium trifluoromethanesulfonate
(Hf(OTf)4, 0.8 mg, 0.001 mmol) in dichloromethane (CH2Cl2, 2 mL) was
stirred at room temperature for 5-240 min. After which the mixture was
filtered through Celite and concentrated under reduced pressure. The
residue was purified by flash column chromatography on silica gel to
afford the corresponding thioacetals 3a-y in high yields.
1-(Bis(ethylthio)methyl)-4-chlorobenzene (3c): 99% Yield; colorless oil;
1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.39 (d, 2H, J = 8.4 Hz), 7.29 (d, 2H, J = 8.4
Hz), 4.89 (s, 1H), 2.63-2.47 (m, 4H), 1.22 (t, 6H, J = 7.4 Hz); 13C NMR
(75 MHz, CDCl3) δ 139.1, 133.4, 129.0, 128.6, 51.7, 26.2, 14.2; FTIR
(film) 2966, 2925, 2869, 1506, 1488, 1473, 1456, 1264, 1087, 1013, 840,
773, 745 cm-1; MS 246 (M+), 185, 157, 125; HRMS (TOF MS ES+) m/z: Calcd
for C11H15ClNaS2 [M+Na]+: 269.0202. Found: 269.0199.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford 4-Methoxyphenyl
octyl sulfide as a colorless liquid, yield 99%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.33 (d,
J = 8.8 Hz, 2H), 6.84 (d, J = 8.8 Hz, 2H), 3.79 (s, 3H), 2.81 (t, J = 7.5
Hz, 2H), 1.57 (quint, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.38 (quint, J = 6.8 Hz, 2H),
1.31-1.25 (m, 8H), 0.87 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 158.7,
132.8 (2C), 127.0, 144.4, 55.2, 35.8, 31.7, 29.3, 29.1, 29.1, 28.7, 22.6,
14.0; IR (neat) 2954, 2927, 2850, 1593, 1493, 1462, 1439, 1284, 1234,
1173, 1074 cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 252 (M+); HRMS (EI) calcd for C15H24OS
(M+) 252.1548, found 252.1560.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Facile preparation of aryl sulfides using palladium catalysis under mild
conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Okauchi, Tatsuo; Kuramoto, Kouji; Kitamura, Mitsuru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2010), (19), 2891-2894

$DATUM 108-88-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 3-(t-Butylthiomethyl)-1-mesitylpyrrolidine-2,5-dione (130b):
Representative procedures for enantioselective protonation reaction of
itaconimide with thiol catalyzed by chiral bicyclic guanidine: 225 microL
(2.00 mmol, 20.0 equiv.) of t-butyl thiol was dissolved in toluene (0.50
mL) in a 4 mL sample vial. Catalyst 7c (2.23 mg, 0.0100 mmol, 0.100
equiv.) was added and the vial was submerged in cryobath at -20 degC.
After being stirred for 10 min, itaconimide 126b (18.7 mg, 0.100 mmol,
1.00 equiv.) was added as solid and stirred for 2 hours. The reaction was
monitored by TLC. Upon completion of the reaction, the reaction mixture
was loaded onto silica gel column. It was purified by gradient elution
(hexane/EtOAc = 25/1 to 2/1) to afford product 130a with a yield of 90 %.
For aromatic thiols, 1.10 equivalents were used instead of 20.0
equivalents. According to the representative procedure, the title
compound was obtained. Colourless liquid; 99 % yield. [alpha 29 D] =
+16.1 deg (c = 2.6 in CHCl3).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Chiral Guanidine Catalyzed Enantioselective Protonation Reactions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Leow, Dasheng Jackson
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM (2010), (20140701), No pp.

$DATUM A solution of allyl glycidyl ether (571 mg, 5.0 mmol) and allyl mercaptan
(93 %, 0.60 mL, 6 mmol) in MeOH (20 mL) was treated with KOH (337 mg, 6.0
mmol). After stirring at rt for 1 h, the reaction mixture was poured into
water (50 mL) and extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 × 20 mL) The combined organic
extracts were washed with brine, dried (Na2SO4) and concentrated to
dryness under vacuum. The crude alcohol was then dissolved in anhydrous
DMF (20 mL), treated at 0 °C with tertbutyldimethylsilyl chloride (904
mg, 6.0 mmol) and imidazole (510 mg, 7.5 mmol). After stirring at rt for
12 h, reaction mixture was poured into water (50 mL) and extracted with
EtOAc (2 × 30mL). The combined organic extracts were washed with brine,
dried (Na2SO4) and concentrated to dryness under vacuum. Purification by
flash column chromatography on silica (CH2Cl2/hexanes 1:2) gave the
sulfide 12 (1.49 g, 98.5 %) as a colorless oil. 1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz):
0.09 (3H, s), 0.11 (3H, s), 0.90 (9H, s), 2.55 (1H, dd, J = 5.9, 13.5
Hz), 2.68 (1H, dd, J = 5.9, 13.5 Hz), 3.15 (2H, d, J = 7.2 Hz), 3.43 (1H,
dd, J = 5.6, 9.8 Hz), 3.51 (1H, dd, J = 5.2, 9.8 Hz), 3.94 (1H, quint, J
= 5.6 Hz), 4.00 (2H, dt, J = 5.5, 1.3 Hz), 5.08-5.13 (2H, m), 5.18 (1H,
br d, J = 10.5 Hz), 5.28 (1H, br d, J = 15.7 Hz), 5.80 (1H, ddt, J = 9.9,
17.0, 7.2 Hz), 5.90 (1H, ddt, J = 10.5, 17.2, 5.6 Hz). 13C NMR (CDCl3,
125 MHz): -4.64, -4.53, 18.15, 25.85, 35.11, 35.66, 71.40, 72.25, 73.42,
116.72, 116.96, 134.58, 134.78. Anal. Calcd for C15H30O2SSi: C, 59.55; H,
9.99. Found: C, 59.53; H, 9.98.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of Chain Transfer Agents. In a
typical run, to a stirred solution of 3-(mercaptopropyl)trimethoxysilane
(95%, 6.20 g, 30 mmol) in 50 mL of anhydrous methanol was added dropwise
a solution of sodium methoxide in methanol (25 wt %, 6.48 g, 30 mmol)
under nitrogen. After stirring for 30 min, CS2 (3.05 g, 40 mmol) was
added dropwise to the solution, and the mixture was then stirred at
ambient temperature for 5 h. To the yellow solution was added benzyl
bromide (98%, 5.24 g, 30 mmol), and the mixture was stirred overnight
under nitrogen. The mixture was concentrated, diluted with
dichloromethane, filtered off, and concentrated under reduced pressure
until constant weight. Other CTAs such as S-methoxycarbonylphenylmethyl
S'-propyltrithiocarbonate (MPPT) was synthesized according to a similar
procedure using 3-(mercaptopropyl)trimethoxysilane and 1-propanethiol as
raw materials and obtained in almost quantitative yield. MPPT was
purified by silica flash column chloromatography using a gradient eluent
of 4:1 hexane/dichloromethane (v/v) to pure dichloromethane and obtained
as a yellow solid product in 98.7% isolated yield. mp 35-36 °C. 1H NMR
(CDCl3): δ 7.34 (m, 5H, PhH), 5.82 (s, 1H, CH), 3.75 (s, 3H, CH3O), 3.33
(t, J7, 2H, CH2S), 1.74 (m, 2H, CH2), 1.01 (t, J7, 3H, CH3). 13C NMR
(CDCl3): δ 221.8 (C=S), 169.3 (C=O), 133.0, 128.9, 128.8, 128.6 (PhC),
57.7, 53.0, 38.9, 21.3, 13.3. IR (cm-1): 3062, 3036, 3010, 2961, 2931,
2871, 1745, 1600, 1583, 1494, 1482, 1454, 1433, 1398, 1378, 1331, 1301,
1285, 1206, 1187, 1150, 1088, 1065, 1047, 1029, 998, 969, 923, 896, 855,
829, 817, 797, 785, 757, 731, 697. Anal, calcd for C13H16O2S3: C, 51.97%;
H, 5.37%; S, 32.02%. Found: C, 51.92%; H, 5.38%; S, 32.00%. ESI-MS: m/z =
301.0386 [M + H]+, theoretical value = 301.0385 (calcd for C13H17O2S3).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Reversible Addition-Fragmentation Chain Transfer Graft Polymerization
Mediated by Fumed Silica Supported Chain Transfer Agents
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhao, Youliang; Perrier, Sebastien
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Macromolecules (Washington, DC, United States) (2007), 40(25), 9116-9124

$DATUM Preparation of
4-Methy4'-(4-propylsulfanylbutyl)-2,2'-bipyridinyl(pSdMBpy). A mixture of
2.0 g of Allyl dMBpy (8.90 mmol), 3.40 g of 1-propanethiol (44.5 mmol),
20 mg of AIBN, and dry CHCl3 (50 mL) were added to a 100 mL flask. The
reaction mixture was refluxed for 12 h under argon. The CHCl3 was removed
by vacuum, and the product was isolated by a careful vacuum distation of
the light volatiles and excess 1-propanethiol at 80 °C for 1 h at 10
mTorr to yield 3.75 g. Viscous orange oil, yield 2.67 g, >99%. C18H24N2S
1H NMR (CDCl3): δ = 0.95 (t, 3H, -SCH2CH2CH3), δ = 1.58 (m, 4H,
-CH2CH2SCH2CH2-), δ = 1.79 (m, 2H, -CH2CH2- CH2SCH2CH2CH3), δ = 2.42 (s,
3H, -CH3), δ = 2.49 (m, 4H, -CH2SCH2-), δ = 2.70 (t, 2H,
-CH2CH2CH2CH2SCH2CH2- CH3), δ = 7.13 (d, 2H, -(CH3 or CH2)-CCHCHNCCH-), δ
= 8.21 (s, 2H, -(CH3 or CH2)-CCHCHNCCH-), δ = 8.55 (d, 2H, -(CH3 or
CH2)-CCHCHNCCH-).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 4-Fluoro-2-nitro-1-propylsulfanylbenzene Potassium carbonate (5.0 g, 36.2
mmol) and 1-propanethiol (2.7 g, 35.5 mmol) were added to a
N-methylpyrolidone (NMP) solution (15 ml) of 2,5-difluoronitrobenzene
(5.0 g, 31.4 mmol), and the mixture obtained was stirred at 90°C for 2
hours. After the reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature, water
(50ml) was added, and the reaction product was extracted with ethyl
acetate (100ml). The organic layer was washed with water, and then dried
over anhydrous magnesium sulfate. The resulting dry product was
concentrated under reduced pressure to thereby obtain 6.7 g of powdery
yellow 4-fluoro-2-nitro-1-propylsulfanylbenzene (yield: 99%).
4-Fluoro-2-nitro-1-propylsulfanylbenzene, yield 6.7 g, 99%. 1H-NMR
(CDCl3) dppm: 1.06 (3H, t, J=7.5 Hz), 1.68-1.83 (2H, m), 2.89 (2H, t, 7.5
Hz), 7.27-7.42 (2H, m), 7.89 (2H, dd, J=2.75 Hz, J=8.5 Hz)

$DATUM Hexylamine catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with acrylonitrile To a 20
mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591 g, 5.0 mmoles)
and hexylamine (22.0 μL, 2.0 wt%). To this was added acrylonitrile (0.265
g, 5.0 mmoles) and the mixture quickly agitated. Yield > 99%. 1H NMR: (a)
δ 2.75 - 2.70 ppm (m, 4H); (b) δ 2.61 - 2.51 ppm (t, 2H); (c) δ 1.58 -
1.48 ppm (m, 2H); (d) δ 1.41 - 1.27 ppm (m, 6H); (e) δ 0.86 - 0.81 (t,
3H); 13C NMR: (a) δ 118.24 ppm; (b) δ 32.00 ppm; (c) δ 31.12 ppm; (d) δ
29.16 ppm; (e) δ 28.19 ppm; (f) δ 27.35 ppm; (g) δ 22.28 ppm; (h) δ 18.89
ppm; (i) δ 13.78 ppm; (neat; 3 hours.; RT).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 5204-74-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure of the thia-Michael reaction
A solution of 1 mmol thiols and 1.2 mmol α,β-unsaturated nitriles and
carbonyl compounds in 2 cm3 TEAA was stirred at 25 °C for 1minutes. The
completions of the reactions were monitored by TLC. The product formed in
one phase system was diluted with 20 cm3 H2O and extracted with 2×25 cm3
ether. The combined organic layer was separated, dried (Na2SO4) and
evaporated under reduced pressure to afford the addition products. The
aqueous layer consisting of the IL was subjected to distillation at 80 °C
and 5 mmHg for 2 h to remove water, leaving behind the IL, which was
further recycled. The conversion and the yield were not reduced after
being reused 10 times. The products, thus isolated, were pure and
recrystallized from EtOAc: petroleum ether (single spot on TLC).
3-(4-Phenylpiperazin-1-yl)cyclohexanone (1e) Colorless oil.
3-(Octylsulfanyl)propionitrile (2l) Colorless oil Yield 99%. C11H21NS 1H
NMR (300MHz, CDCl3): δ = 0.88 (t, J= 6.0Hz, 3H), 1.27-1.40 (m, 10H),
1.54-1.69 (m, 2H), 2.56-2.66 (m, 4H), 2.75-2.80 (m, 2H) ppm; 13C NMR
(75MHz, CDCl3): δ =14.09, 18.93, 22.42, 22.64, 27.40, 28.55, 29.24,
29.94, 31.81, 32.04, 118.24 ppm; LC-MS: m/z (%)=199.14 (100, M+1).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective, green chemistry-catalyst, ionic liquid used, thia-Michael
reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Triethylammonium acetate (TEAA): a recyclable inexpensive ionic liquid
promotes the chemoselective aza- and thia-Michael reactions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Verma, Akhilesh K.; Attri, Pankaj; Chopra, Varun; Tiwari, Rakesh K.;
Chandra, Ramesh
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Monatshefte fuer Chemie (2008), 139(9), 1041-1047

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 121-44-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-66-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Inimer RAFT Agent Synthesis. n-Butanethiol (5.4 g, 6.4 mL, 0.06 mol),
carbon disulfide (9.1 g, 7.3 mL, 0.120 mol), and chloroform (50 mL) were
added to a flask purged with argon. Triethylamine (12.5 g, 17.3 mL, 0.124
mol) was then added dropwise with stirring. The solution became orange as
the addition proceeded with the formation of the intermediate
triethylammonium S-n-butyl trithiocarbonate salt. The solution was left
to stir at room temperature for 2.5 h. 1-Chloromethyl-4-vinylbenzene
(9.16 g, 8.45 mL, 0.06 mol) was then added dropwise, and the solution was
left to stir under argon. Volatiles were removed under rotavaporation,
poured into deionized water, and extracted with CHCl3. The organic layer
was washed 2× with the following: deionized water, 1 M HCl, and brine.
This was then dried over anhydrous MgSO4, filtered and the solvent
removed A yellow oil (16.96 g, yield ~99%). The crude compound was
further purified on silica column chromatography running a gradient from
hexane to 5% DCM in hexane to obtain a pure fraction (14 g, yield = 83%,
NMR purity of ~95%). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 0.94 (tr, CH3, 3H), 1.43
(m, CH2, 2H), 1.67 (m, CH2, 2H), 3.37 (tr, CH2, 2H), 4.59 (s, CH3, 2H),
5.24 (d, CH=CHH, 1H), 5.73 (d, CH=CHH, 1H), 6.68 (q, CH=CH2, 1H),
7.28-7.36 (q, aromatic CH, 4H). 13C NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 13.6, 22.1,
30.1, 36.8, 41.1, 114.2, 126.5, 129.5, 134.7, 136.3, 137.1, 223.3.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM triethylammonium S-n-butyl trithiocarbonate salt formed (stage 1)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly-Branched Poly(N-isopropylacrylamide) as a Component in
Poly(dopamine) Films
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhang, Yan; Teo, Boon M.; Postma, Almar; Ercole, Francesca; Ogaki,
Ryosuke; Zhu, Meifang; Stadler, Brigitte
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Physical Chemistry B (2013), 117(36), 10504-10512

$DATUM (E)-butyl(styryl)sulfane (Table 4, entry 1): The general procedure was
used to convert butane-1-thiol and (E)-1-(2-iodovinyl)benzene to the
title product in 4 hours. Purification by flash chromatography (silica
gel) (3% triethylamine in hexane as the eluent) gave the analytically
pure product as a colorless oil (379 mg, 98% yield). 1H NMR (400
MHz,CDCl3) δ 7.28-7.27 (m, 4H), 7.20-7.15 (m, 1H), 6.74-6.70 (d, J= 15.6
Hz; 1H), 6.47-6.43(d, J= 15.6 Hz; 1H), 2.81-2.77 (t, J= 7.3 Hz; 2H),
1.71-1.63 (m, 2H), 1.50-1.41 (m, 2H),0.96-0.92 (t, J= 7.3 Hz; 3H). 13C
NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 137.10, 128.55, 126.67,126.53, 125.37, 125.31,
32.23, 31.46, 21.89, 13.63. Anal. Calc’d. for C12H16S: C -74.94;H -8.39;
S -16.67; Found, C -75.08; H -8.37; S -16.88.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure: Thiol (1 mmol) is added to
a solution of sodium tert-butoxide (1.1 mmol) in 0.3 mL THF under
nitrogen. This reaction mixture is stirred at 23 °C for 10 min. At this
time, a solution of ZnCl2 (0.64 mmol) in 0.4 mL of THF is added and the
mixture is stirred for an additional 10 min. The desired aryl halide (1
mmol) is added followed by a solution of LiI (0.5 mmol) in 0.3mL of THF,
and a solution of the catalyst [Pd(μ-Br)(PtBu3)]2 in 0.4 mL of THF. This
reaction is stirred at 90 °C for 2 h. When the reaction is complete as
measured by GC, silica is added to the reaction mixture and the solvent
is removed under reduced pressure. The adsorbed crude residue is purified
by column chromatography using a pentane/ether eluent. All of the
isolated sulfide products contain ≤ 5 % impurity as judged by 1H NMR
spectroscopy. 4-(Butylthio)benzonitrile (Table 2, Entry 3). The reaction
was performed according to the general procedure with 182.0 mg (0.9999
mmol) of 4-bromobenzonitrile to give 99 % of the sulfide (190.0 mg,
0.9933 mmol) as a clear liquid.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM procedure used from supporting information
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Zinc-Mediated Palladium-Catalyzed Formation of Carbon-Sulfur Bonds
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Eichman, Chad C.; Stambuli, James P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(10), 4005-4008

$DATUM Hexylamine catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with diethyl maleate To a 20
mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591 g, 5.0 mmoles)
and hexylamine (39.0 μL, 2.0 wt%). To this was added diethyl maleate
(0.860 g, 5.0 mmoles) and the mixture quickly agitated. Yield > 99%. 1H
NMR: (a) δ 4.21 - 4.07 ppm (m, 4H); (b) δ 3.62 - 3.57 ppm (m, 1H); (c) δ
2.98 - 2.54 ppm (m, 4H); (d) δ 1.60 - 1.44 ppm (m, 2H); (e) δ 1.35 - 1.19
(m, 12H); (f) δ 0.86 - 0.82 ppm (t, 3H); 13C NMR: (a) δ 171.68 ppm; (b) δ
170.59 ppm; (c) δ 61.18 ppm; (d) δ 60.79 ppm; (e) δ 41.38 ppm; (f) δ
36.43 ppm; (g) δ 31.35 ppm; (h) δ 31.22 ppm; (i) δ 29.05 ppm; (j) δ 28.35
ppm; (k) δ 22.39 ppm; (l) δ 14.01 ppm; (m) δ 13.89 ppm (neat; 3 hours;
RT).

$DATUM Hexylamine catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with N-propylmaleimide To a
20 mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591 g, 5.0
mmoles) and hexylamine (34.0 μL, 2.0 wt%). To this was added
N-propylmaleimide (0.695 g, 5.0 mmoles) and the mixture quickly agitated.
Yield > 99%. 1H NMR: (a) δ 3.70 - 3.66 ppm (m, 1H); (b) δ 3.47 - 3.42 ppm
(t, 2H); (c) δ 3.14 - 3.05 and 2.54 - 2.45 ppm (m, 2H); (d) δ 2.88 - 2.67
ppm (m, 2H); (e) δ 1.68 - 1.50 (m, 4H); (f) δ 1.41 - 1.32 ppm (m, 2H);
(g) δ 1.28 - 1.23 ppm (m, 4H); (h) δ 0.90 - 0.82 ppm (m, 6H); 13C NMR:
(a) δ 176.64 ppm; (b) δ 174.81 ppm; (c) δ 40.47 ppm; (d) δ 38.91 ppm; (e)
δ 36.00 ppm; (f) δ 31.58 ppm; (g) δ 31.24 ppm; (h) δ 28.88 ppm; (i) δ
28.37 ppm; (j) δ 22.42 ppm; (k) δ 20.87 ppm; (l) δ 13.93 ppm; (m) δ 11.12
ppm (neat; 3 hours; RT).

$DATUM DBN catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with hexyl acrylate To a 20 mL
glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591 g, 5.0 mmoles) and
DBN (0.65 μL, 0.05 wt%). To this was added hexyl acrylate (0.781 g, 5.0
mmoles) and the mixture quickly agitated. Yield > 99%. 1H NMR: (a) δ 4.08
- 4.03 ppm (t, 2H); (b) δ 2.77 - 2.72 ppm (t, 2H); (c) δ 2.59 - 2.47 ppm
(m, 4H); (d) δ 1.62 - 1.52 ppm (hept, 4H); (e) δ 1.36 - 1.27 ppm (broad
m, (14+) H, hexyl amine region); (f) δ 0.87 - 0.83 ppm (broad t, 6H); 13C
NMR: (a) δ 171.97 ppm; (b) δ 64.71 ppm; (c) δ 34.86 ppm (d) δ 32.03 ppm;
(e) δ 31.32 ppm; (f) δ 29.42 ppm; (g) δ 28.45 ppm; (h) δ 26.91 ppm; (i) δ
25.48 ppm; (j) δ 22.48 - 22.44 ppm; (k) δ 13.93 - 13.90 ppm; (neat; 3
hours.; RT).

25.44 ppm; (j) δ 22.41 ppm; (k) δ 13.89 - 13.86 ppm; (neat; 3 hours.;
RT).

$DATUM Hexylamine-Catalyzed Reaction of Hexanethiol with Hexyl Acrylate. To a 20
mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.590 g, 5.0 mmol) and
hexylamine (10 μL, 0.55 wt %). To this was added hexyl acrylate (0.781 g,
5.0 mmol), and the mixture quickly agitated. yield >99%. 1H NMR: (a) δ
4.07- 4.03 ppm (t, 2H); (b) δ 2.77 -2.71 ppm (t, 2H); (c) δ 2.58-2.46 ppm
(m, 4H); (d) δ 1.63-1.49 ppm (hept, 4H); (e) δ 1.39-1 0.27 ppm (broad m,
(14+) H, hexylamine region); (f) δ 0.87-0.83 ppm (broad t, 6H). 13C NMR:
(a) δ 171.97 ppm; (b) δ 64.72 ppm; (c) δ 34.87 ppm; (d) δ 32.04 ppm; (e)
δ 31.33 ppm; (f) δ 29.43 ppm; (g) δ 28.45 ppm; (h) δ 26.93 ppm; (i) δ
25.48 ppm; (j) δ 22.50-22.47 ppm; (k) δ 13.92-13.89 ppm (neat, 3 h, RT).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM thiol-Michael reaction, Effect of amine and phosphine catalysts studied,
no solvent, kinetics studied

$DATUM Dimethylphenylphosphine catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with hexyl
acrylate To a 20 mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591
g, 5.0 mmoles) and dimethylphenylphosphine (0.65 μL, 0.05 wt%). To this
was added hexyl acrylate (0.781 g, 5.0 mmoles) and the mixture quickly
agitated. Yield > 99%. 1H NMR: (a) δ 4.08 - 4.03 ppm (t, 2H); (b) δ 2.77
- 2.72 ppm (t, 2H); (c) δ 2.58 - 2.47 ppm (m, 4H); (d) δ 1.62 - 1.49 ppm
(hept, 4H); (e) δ 1.39 - 1.24 ppm (broad m, (14+) H, hexyl amine region);
(f) δ 0.87 - 0.83 ppm (broad t, 6H); 13C NMR: (a) δ 171.97 ppm; (b) δ
64.72 ppm; (c) δ 34.87 ppm (d) δ 32.04 ppm; (e) δ 31.33 ppm; (f) δ 29.43
ppm; (g) δ 28.46 ppm; (h) δ 26.92 ppm; (i) δ 25.48 ppm; (j) δ 22.45 -
22.47 ppm; (k) δ 13.93 - 13.89 ppm; (neat; 3 hours.; RT).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Tripropylphosphine catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with hexyl acrylate
To a 20 mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591 g, 5.0
mmoles) and tripropylphosphine (0.85 μL, 0.06 wt%). To this was added
hexyl acrylate (0.781 g, 5.0 mmoles) and the mixture quickly agitated.
yield > 99%. 1H NMR: (a) δ 4.08 - 4.03 ppm (t, 2H); (b) δ 2.77 - 2.72 ppm
(t, 2H); (c) δ 2.59 - 2.47 ppm (m, 4H); (d) δ 1.62 - 1.50 ppm (hept, 4H);
(e) δ 1.37 - 1.24 ppm (broad m, (14+) H, hexyl amine region); (f) δ 0.88
- 0.83 ppm (broad t, 6H); 13C NMR: (a) δ 171.98 ppm; (b) δ 64.73 ppm; (c)
δ 34.88 ppm (d) δ 32.05 ppm; (e) δ 31.33 ppm; (f) δ 29.44 ppm; (g) δ
28.46 ppm; (h) δ 26.93 ppm; (i) δ 25.48 ppm; (j) δ 22.46 - 22.45 ppm; (k)
δ 13.94 - 13.90 ppm; (neat; 3 hours.; RT).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 111-26-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Hexylamine catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with N,N-dimethylacrylamide
To a 20 mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591 g, 5.0
mmoles) and hexylamine (29.0 μL, 2.0 wt%). To this was added
N,N-dimethylacrylamide (0.495 g, 5.0 mmoles) and the mixture quickly
agitated. Yield > 99%. 1H NMR: (a) δ 2.83 ppm (s, 3H); (b) δ 2.80 ppm (t,
2H); (c) δ 2.72 - 2.67 ppm (t, 2H); (d) δ 2.50 - 2.45 ppm (t, 2H); (e) δ
2.44 - 2.39 (t, 2H); (f) δ 1.51 - 1.42 ppm (m, 2H); (g) δ 1.30 - 1.12 ppm
(m, 6H); (h) 1.12 - 0.74 ppm (t, 3H); 13C NMR: (a) δ 170.92 ppm; (b) δ
36.82 ppm; (c) δ 35.09 ppm; (d) δ 33.54 ppm; (e) δ 32.17 ppm; (f) δ 31.12
ppm; (g) δ 29.31 ppm; (h) δ 28.24 ppm; (i) δ 27.12 ppm; (j) δ 22.23 ppm;
(k) δ 13.72 ppm; (neat; 3 hours.; RT).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DATUM Hexylamine catalyzed reaction of hexanethiol with diethyl fumarate To a
20 mL glass scintillation vial was added hexanethiol (0.591 g, 5.0
mmoles) and hexylamine (39.0 μL, 2.0 wt%). To this was added diethyl
fumarate (0.860 g, 5.0 mmoles) and the mixture quickly agitated. Yield >
99%. 1H NMR: (a) δ 4.22 - 4.08 ppm (m, 4H); (b) δ 3.64 - 3.59 ppm (m,
1H); (c) δ 3.00 - 2.55 ppm (m, 4H); (d) δ 1.61 - 1.45 ppm (m, 2H); (e) δ
1.38 - 1.18 (m, 12H); (f) δ 0.87 - 0.83 ppm (t, 3H); 13C NMR: (a) δ
171.72 ppm; (b) δ 170.64 ppm; (c) δ 61.23 ppm; (d) δ 60.83 ppm; (e) δ
41.41 ppm; (f) δ 36.47 ppm; (g) δ 31.38 ppm; (h) δ 31.25 ppm; (i) δ 29.08
ppm; (j) δ 28.39 ppm; (k) δ 22.43 ppm; (l) δ 14.04 ppm; (m) δ 13.93 ppm
(neat; 3 hours; RT).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Coupling with Thiols; General Procedure A
mixture of thiol (11.4 mmol), 2-bromobenzoic acid (8.8 mmol), K2CO3 (1.21
g, 8.8 mmol), Cu powder (51 mg, 0.8 mmol), Cu2O (38 mg, 0.4 mmol) and
2-ethoxyethanol (3 mL) was heated to 130 °C for 4 h. The reaction was
cooled to r.t. and the solvent was removed under reduced pressure. The
residue was poured into H2O (30 mL), treated with charcoal and the
mixture was filtrated through Celite. Acidification of the filtrate with
diluted HCl (pH 5) gave a precipitate, which was dissolved in aq Na2CO3
(5%, 100 mL) and the solution was filtrated through Celite and subjected
to precipitation as described above. Precipitation upon acidification
gave pure sulfides. 2-(Hexylthio)benzoic Acid (50), yield >99%. 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 0.90 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 3 H), 1.29- 1.35 (m, 4 H),
1.44-1.53 (m, 2 H), 1.69-1.80 (m, 2 H), 2.93 (t, J = 7.3 Hz, 2 H), 7.18
(ddd, J = 7.7, 7.3, 1.2 Hz, 1 H), 7.33 (d, J = 7.7 Hz, 1 H), 7.48 (ddd, J
= 8.1, 7.3, 1.5 Hz, 1 H), 8.13 (dd, J = 8.1, 1.7 Hz, 1 H). 13C NMR (75
MHz, CDCl3): δ = 15.1, 23.6, 29.2, 30.0, 32.5, 33.3, 124.8, 126.7, 127.3,
133.7, 134.2, 144.4, 172.9. Anal. Calcd for C13H18O2S: C, 65.51; H, 7.61.
Found: C, 65.22; H, 7.92.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 108-88-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford
3-Octylthiobenzenecarbaldehyde as a colorless oil, yield 99%. 1H NMR
(CDCl3) δ 9.98 (s, 1H), 7.79 (t, J = 1.6 Hz, 1H), 7.64 (dt, J = 7.5 Hz
and 1.3 Hz, 1H), 7.56-7.53 (m, 1H), 7.46-7.42 (m, 1H), 2.98 (t, J = 7.4
Hz, 2H), 1.67 (quint, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.46 (quint, J = 6.9 Hz, 2H),
1.28-1.27 (m, 8H), 0.88 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 191.5,
139.1, 136.7, 133.6, 129.1, 128.0, 126.7, 32.8, 31.6, 29.0, 28.9, 28.7,
28.6, 22.4, 13.9; IR (neat) 2960, 2926, 2852, 2717, 1703, 1572, 1466,
1435, 1377, 1271, 1196, 1159, 1099, 1005, 903 cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 250
(M+); HRMS (EI) calcd for C15H22OS (M+) 250.1391, found 250.1400.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Facile preparation of aryl sulfides using palladium catalysis under mild
conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Okauchi, Tatsuo; Kuramoto, Kouji; Kitamura, Mitsuru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2010), (19), 2891-2894

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added

358 (M+); HRMS (EI) calcd for C16H20F6S (M+) 358.1190, found 358.1181.

$DATUM Propargylation of Aliphatic Thiols (4a-c) with Propargylic Carbonate
(1a). A mixture of propargylic carbonate (1a, 1.0 mmol), aliphatic thiol
(4, 1.2 mmol), CpRuCl(PPh3)2 (0.030 mmol), and N-methylpiperidine (3.0
mL) was placed in a two-necked 20-mL Pyrex flask equipped with a magnetic
stirring bar under a flow of argon. The reaction was carried out at 100°C
for 8 h with stirring. After the reaction mixture was cooled, the
products were isolated by column chromatography (Florisil® (60-100 mesh),
eluent: pentane/ethyl acetate (50/1 in v/v)). Octyl 3-phenylprop-2-ynyl
sulfide (5a). Yellow liquid, yield 99% bp 110-120°C (5.0 mmHg,
Kugelrohr); IR (neat) 1442, 2358, 2925 cm-1; 1H NMR (CDCl3, 300 MHz): δ
0.87 (t, 3H, J=6.79 Hz), 1.10-1.60 (m, 10H), 1.66 (quintet, 2H, J=7.16
Hz), 2.73 (t, 2H, J=7.34 Hz), 3.48 (s, 2H), 7.24-7.41 (m, 5H); 13C NMR
(CDCl3, 75 MHz): δ 14.1, 20.2, 22.6, 28.8, 29.1, 29.2 (two overlapping
signals), 31.7, 31.8, 82.8, 85.6, 123.1, 128.0, 128.2, 131.7; MS (EI) m/z
260 (M+). Anal. Calcd for C17H24S: C 78.40, H 9.29. Found: C 78.54, H
9.56.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford 4-Fluorophenyl
octyl sufide as a colorless oil, yield 99%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.35-7.30
(m, 2H), 7.02-6.96 (m, 2H), 2.85 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.60 (quint, J =
7.6 Hz, 2H), 1.39 (quint, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 1.33-1.26 (m, 8H), 0.88 (t, J
= 7.1 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 162.7, 160.2, 131.8, 131.7, 115.8,
115.6, 34.8, 31.7, 29.1, 29.1, 29.1, 28.7, 22.6, 14.0; IR (neat) 2956,
2926, 2852, 1589, 1489, 1458, 1377, 1275, 1261, 1223, 1155, 1092, 1012,
927 cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 240 (M+); HRMS (EI) calcd for C14H21FS (M+)
240.1348, found 240.1337.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Facile preparation of aryl sulfides using palladium catalysis under mild
conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Okauchi, Tatsuo; Kuramoto, Kouji; Kitamura, Mitsuru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2010), (19), 2891-2894

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford Octyl 2-quinolyl
sulfide as a white solid, yield 99%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 8.84 (d, J = 2.3
Hz, 1H), 8.06 (d, J = 8.5 Hz, 1H), 8.03 (d, J = 2.2 Hz, 1H), 7.73 (d, J =
8.1 Hz, 1H), 7.68-7.64 (m, 1H), 7.56-7.52 (m, 1H), 3.02 (t, J = 7.4 Hz,

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 108-88-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford 2-Methoxyphenyl
octyl sulfide as a colorless liquid, yield 99%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.27
(dd, J = 6.2 Hz and 1.3 Hz, 2H), 7.18-7.14 (m, 1H), 6.94-6.91 (m, 1H),
6.85 (d, J = 8.1 Hz, 1H), 3.89 (s, 3H), 2.88 (t, J = 7.3 Hz, 2H), 1.66
(quint, J = 7.6 Hz, 2H), 1.44 (quint, J = 7.4 Hz, 2H), 1.27-1.26 (m, 8H),
0.88 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 157.0, 128.6, 126.5, 125.2,
120.9, 110.2, 55.6, 31.8, 31.7, 29.0, 28.9, 28.8, 22.5, 14.0; IR (neat)
2954, 2927, 2850, 1578, 1477, 1431, 1377, 1306, 1273, 1236, 1182, 1024
cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 252 (M+); HRMS (EI) calcd for C15H24OS (M+)
252.1548, found 252.1558.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Facile preparation of aryl sulfides using palladium catalysis under mild
conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Okauchi, Tatsuo; Kuramoto, Kouji; Kitamura, Mitsuru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2010), (19), 2891-2894

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 110-71-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Coupling of Aryl
Bromides and Iodides with Aliphatic and Aromatic Thiols. The appropriate
quantity of stock solution A or B was added to a 4 mL vial containing the
aryl bromide or iodide (1.00 mmol) and NaOtBu (106 mg, 1.10 mmol) in DME
(1.5 mL). The thiol (1.00 mmol) was then added and the vial sealed with a
cap containing a PTFE septum. The mixture was heated at the temperature
indicated in Tables 4 and 5 until the aryl halide was consumed, as
determined by GC. Silica gel (0.5 g) was added, and the solvents were
evaporated under reduced pressure. The crude residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel with hexane or a mixture of hexane
and ethyl acetate as eluent. Aryl sulfides were isolated in the yields
reported in Tables 4 and 5. 2-Methoxyphenyl octyl sulfide (Table 4,
entries 20-21).8 Colorless liquid, yield 99% 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ 7.23 (dd,
J = 7.6 Hz and 1.6 Hz, 1H), 7.15-7.12 (m, 1H), 6.90 (td, J = 7.6 Hz and
1.3 Hz, 1H), 6.82 (dd, J = 8.0 Hz and 1.3 Hz, 1H), 3.86 (s, 3H), 2.87 (t,
J = 7.6 Hz, 2H), 1.65 (quint, J = 7.6 Hz, 2H), 1.43 (m, 2H), 1.31-1.22
(m, 8 H), 0.87 (t, J = 6.9 Hz, 3H). 13C NMR (CDCl3): δ 156.9, 128.4,
126.4, 125.1, 120.8, 110.1, 55.5, 31.7, 31.6, 29.0 (2C), 28.8, 28.7,
22.5, 13.9.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM silica gel used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A General, Efficient, and Functional-Group-Tolerant Catalyst System for
the Palladium-Catalyzed Thioetherification of Aryl Bromides and Iodides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Fernandez-Rodriguez, Manuel A.; Hartwig, John F.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(4), 1663-1672

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford 4-Nitrophenyl
octyl sufide as a white solid, yield 99%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 8.12 (dt, J =
9.0 Hz and 2.0 Hz, 2H), 7.31 (dt, J = 9.0 Hz and 2.0 Hz, 2H), 3.01 (t, J
= 7.4 Hz, 2H), 1.72 (quint, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.46 (quint, J = 7.7 Hz,
2H), 1.34-1.28 (m, 8H), 0.88 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ
148.1, 144.6, 125.7, 123.7, 31.7, 31.6, 31.0, 28.9, 28.7, 28.3, 22.5,
13.9; IR (neat) 2954, 2927, 2850, 159, 1514, 1479, 1462, 1435, 1325,
1275, 1184, 1090, 1011, 951, 852, 853 cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 267 (M+); HRMS
(EI) calcd for C14H21NO2S (M+) 267.1293, found 267.1299.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 51364-51-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 108-88-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford Methyl
2-octylthiobenzenecarboxylate as a colorless oil, yield 99%. 1H NMR
(CDCl3) δ 7.96 (dd, J = 6.3 Hz and 1.5 Hz, 1H), 7.46-7.41 (m, 1H),
7.32-7.30 (m, 1H), 7.16-7.12 (m, 1H), 3.91 (s, 3H), 2.92 (t, J = 7.5 Hz,
2H), 1.73 (quint, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.48 (quint, J = 7.6 Hz, 2H),
1.34-1.27 (m, 8H), 0.88 (t, J = 7.1 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 166.7,
142.3, 132.1, 131.1, 127.2, 125.2, 123.4, 51.8, 31.9, 31.6, 29.1, 29.0,
28.0, 22.5, 13.9; IR (neat) 2954, 2927, 2852, 1720, 1587, 1562, 1431,
1234, 1190, 1144, 1107, 1045, 964, 823 cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 280 (M+);
HRMS (EI) calcd for C16H24O2S (M+) 280.1497, found 280.1486.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Facile preparation of aryl sulfides using palladium catalysis under mild
conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Okauchi, Tatsuo; Kuramoto, Kouji; Kitamura, Mitsuru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2010), (19), 2891-2894

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford
2-Octylthiobenzenecarbaldehyde as a colorless oil, yield 99%. 1H NMR
(CDCl3) δ 10.4 (s, 1H), 8.83 (dd, J = 6.2 Hz and 1.5 Hz, 1H), 7.53-7.49
(m, 1H), 7.43-7.41 (m, 1H), 7.31-7.27 (m, 1H), 2.95 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H),
1.70 (quint, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.45 (quint, J = 7.7 Hz, 2H), 1.29-1.27 (m,
8H), 0.88 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 191.1, 142.1, 133.7,
133.6, 131.6, 127.8, 124.9, 33.0, 31.6, 28.9, 28.7, 28.3, 22.4, 13.9; IR
(neat) 2954, 2922, 2854, 2735, 1693, 1587, 1459, 1396, 1261, 1194, 1126,
1074, 1062, 1039, 845, 823 cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 250 (M+); HRMS (EI) calcd
for C15H22OS (M+) 250.1391, found 250.1387.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the cross coupling of
aryl bromides and thiols. To a solution of Pd2(dba)3 (9.2 mg, 0.010 mmol)
and DPPF (11.1 mg, 0.020 mmol) in toluene (1.0 ml) were added
bromobenzene (0.11 ml, 1.0 mmol), iPr2NEt (0.19 ml, 1.1 mmol) and
Octanethiol (0.17 ml, 1.0 mmol) at room temperature. After the solution
was stirred under reflux for 3 h, the mixture was cooled to room
temperature. The reaction was then quenched by addition of water. The
mixture was extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL x 3), and the combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over dry Na2SO4, and
filterd. The filtrate was concentrated in vacuo. The residue was purified
by flash column chromatography on silica gel to afford
4-Octylthiophenylmethanol as a white solid, yield 99%. 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ
7.33-7.27 (m, 4H), 4.66 (d, J = 5.9 Hz, 2H), 2.91 (t, J = 7.3 Hz, 2H),
1.67-1.58 (m, 3H), 1.41 (quint, J = 7.2 Hz, 2H), 1.27-1.26 (m, 8H), 0.88
(t, J = 7.1 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 138.2, 135.9, 128.7, 127.3, 64.2,
33.4, 31.6, 29.0, 28.97, 28.93, 28.7, 22.5, 13.9; IR (neat) 3340, 3230,
2954, 2921, 2854, 1601, 1495, 1462, 1408, 1369, 1265, 1203, 1115, 1093,
1039, 993, 984, 800 cm-1; MS (EI): m/z = 252 (M+); HRMS (EI) calcd for
C15H24OS (M+) 252.1548, found 252.1558.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Facile preparation of aryl sulfides using palladium catalysis under mild
conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Okauchi, Tatsuo; Kuramoto, Kouji; Kitamura, Mitsuru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2010), (19), 2891-2894

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 3a. Procedure for Hf(OTf)4-Catalyzed
Thioacetalization: A mixture of carbonyl compounds (aldehydes or ketones,
1a-v, 1.0 mmol), monothiols (ethanethiol or benzenethiol, 2a-2b, 2.0
mmol) or dithiols (1,2-ethanedithiol or 1,3-propanedithiol, 2c-2d, 1.0
mmol), and a small catalytic amount of hafnium trifluoromethanesulfonate
(Hf(OTf)4, 0.8 mg, 0.001 mmol) in dichloromethane (CH2Cl2, 2 mL) was
stirred at room temperature for 5-240 min. After which the mixture was
filtered through Celite and concentrated under reduced pressure. The
residue was purified by flash column chromatography on silica gel to
afford the corresponding thioacetals 3a-y in high yields.
1-(Bis(ethylthio)methyl)-4-bromobenzene (3d): 99% Yield; colorless oil;
1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.45 (d, 2H, J = 8.4 Hz), 7.33 (d, 2H, J = 8.4
Hz), 4.87 (s, 1H), 2.65-2.45 (m, 4H), 1.22 (t, 6H, J = 7.4 Hz); 13C NMR
(75 MHz, CDCl3) δ 139.6, 131.6, 129.4, 121.5, 51.7, 26.2, 14.2; FTIR
(film) 2966, 2924, 2868, 1506, 1486, 1456, 1398, 1263, 1071, 1009, 839,
772, 747 cm-1; MS 292, 290 (M+), 231, 229, 203, 201, 199; HRMS (TOF MS
ES+) m/z: Calcd for C11H15BrNaS2 [M+Na]+: 312.9697. Found: 312.9703.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Cesium-Mediated Addition of Thiol to Alkyne: A
Typical Procedure. The reaction of dodecanethiol with phenylacetylene is
representative (Table 1, entry 10). Cesium carbonate (0.016 g, 0.050
mmol) was placed in a 20-mL reaction flask under argon. Dimethyl
sulfoxide (3.0 mL) and dodecanethiol (0.12 g, 0.60 mmol) were added at
room tem-perature. After the mixture was stirred for 15 min, 2,2,6,6-
tetramethylpiperidine-N-oxyl (0.016 g, 0.10 mmol) was added. The whole
mixture was stirred for 15 min. Finally, phenylacetylene (0.051 g, 0.50
mmol) was added and the resulting mixture was stirred for 4 h. Water (10
mL) was added, and the product was extracted with hexane/ethyl acetate
(40:1, 3 x 10 mL). The combined organic layer was dried over sodium
sulfate and concentrated under reduced pressure. Silica gel column
purification of the crude oil provided 0.13 g of dodecyl styryl sulfide
(1a, 0.43 mmol, E/Z ) 7:93) in 86% yield.
(Z)-2-Dodecylthio-3-phenyl-2-propen-1-ol (1s): IR (Nujol) 3285, 2922,
2853, 1591, 1464, 1445, 1377, 1115, 1101, 972, 849, 752, 691 cm-1; 1H NMR
(CDCl3) δ 0.88 (t, J = 6.8 Hz, 3H), 1.18-1.37 (m, 18H), 1.55 (tt, J =
7.5, 7.5 Hz, 2H), 1.94 (s, 1H), 2.76 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H), 4.36 (s, 2H),
6.82 (s, 1H), 7.25 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 1H), 7.35 (dd, J = 7.5, 7.5 Hz, 2H),
7.60 (d, J = 7.5 Hz, 2H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 14.1, 22.6, 28.7, 29.1, 29.3,
29.4, 29.5, 29.56, 29.57, 29.8, 31.3, 31.9, 66.9, 127.3, 128.0, 129.3,
129.8, 135.6, 136.1. Found: C, 75.16; H, 10.11. Calcd for C21H34OS: C,
75.39; H, 10.24. Mp: 38.0-39.5 °C (amorphous solid).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Stereoselective Hydrothiolation of Alkynes Catalyzed by Cesium Base:
Facile Access to (Z)-1-Alkenyl Sulfides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kondoh, Azusa; Takami, Kazuaki; Yorimitsu, Hideki; Oshima, Koichiro
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2005), 70(16), 6468-6473

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM EXAMPLE 1 [0049]1-Dodecanethiol (75 mL, 312.7 mmol, 1.0 equiv) was added
to a dry 2 L flask equipped with an overhead stirrer, temperature probe,
condensor, and N2 inlet/outlet. DCM (950 ml) was added. Pyridine (25.4
mL, 314 mmol, 1.0 equiv) was added followed by 42 mg of DMAP (0.344 mmol,
0.0011 equiv). The mixture was cooled to 0-5°C. TFAA (50.0 mL, 354 mmol,
1.13 equiv) was then added as a solution in 315 mL DCM. The addition was
done at a rate slow enough to keep the reaction temperature at 0-5°C. The
mixture was then warmed to 20-25°C and stirred there for 1 h. Then the
mixture was heated to 40°C. and held there for 1 h. The mixture was
cooled to 20-25°C. and transferred to a separatory funnel. The mixture
was washed with 950 mL DI water. The aqueous phase was back-extracted
with 2×600 mL DCM. The combined organic phases were then washed with 600
mL DI water. The organic solution was then dried over MgSO4. The solvent
was then removed under vacuum to give 92.2 g of title compound as a clear
liquid (98.8% yield).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Process for the preparation of alkyl and aryl thiotrifluoroacetates
useful as a source of trifluoroacetyl blocking groups for amines and
amino acids
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sharma, Padam N.; Gublo, Edward J.; Boettger, Susan D.; Racha, Saibaba;
Usher, John
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM United States, US20050159612 A1 2005-07-21

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 872-50-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for Table 3. A 4 mL vial
sealed equipped with a magnetic stirrer bar was charged with KOH (56.0
mg, 1.0 mmol) and vinyl bromide (0.6 mmol) in dioxane (0.25 mL); for
vinyl chloride, a 4 mL vial sealed equipped with a magnetic stirrer bar
was charged with KOH (56.0 mg, 1.0 mmol) and vinyl chloride (0.6 mmol) in
NMP (0.5 mL). The aliphatic thiol or aromatic thiol (0.5 mmol) was added
via syringe, and the vial was sealed with a cap containing a PTFE septum
and the reaction vessel was heated at 110 °C in an oil bath. After
stirring at this temperature for 24 h, the heterogeneous mixture was
cooled to room temperature and diluted with ethyl acetate (20 mL). The
resulting solution was directly filtered through a pad of celite then
washed with ethyl acetate (20 mL) and concentrated to give the crude
material which was then purified by column chromatography (SiO2, hexane).
Following the general procedure for Table 3, using
1-(2-bromovinyl)benzene (0.0775 mL, 0.6 mmol) and 1-dodecanethiol (0.1200
mL, 0.5 mmol), then purified by column chromatography (SiO2, hexane).
Following the general procedure for Table 3, using 1-dodecanethiol
(0.1200 mL, 0.5 mmol), 1-(2-chlorovinyl)benzene (83.8 mg, 0.6 mmol), then
purified by column chromatography (SiO2, hexane). Dodecyl(styryl)sulfane
(5a),white solid (150 mg, 99% yield). M.P.: 26-27 °C; 1H NMR (400 MHz,
CDCl3): δ = 0.86-0.89 (m, 3 H), 1.26-1.42 (m, 18 H,), 1.63-1.71 (m, 2 H),
2.73-2.79 (m, 2 H), 6.22 (d, J= 11.2 Hz, 1 H), 6.40-6.46 (m, 2 H), 6.71
(d, J= 15.6 Hz, 1 H), 7.14-7.49(m, 5 H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective, alternative preparation shown, trans:cis = 10:1, sealed
tube used

$DATUM Kao, Hsin-Lun; Lee, Chin-Fa

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Cesium-Mediated Addition of Thiol to Alkyne: A
Typical Procedure. The reaction of dodecanethiol with phenylacetylene is
representative (Table 1, entry 10). Cesium carbonate (0.016 g, 0.050
mmol) was placed in a 20-mL reaction flask under argon. Dimethyl
sulfoxide (3.0 mL) and dodecanethiol (0.12 g, 0.60 mmol) were added at
room tem-perature. After the mixture was stirred for 15 min, 2,2,6,6-
tetramethylpiperidine-N-oxyl (0.016 g, 0.10 mmol) was added. The whole
mixture was stirred for 15 min. Finally, phenylacetylene (0.051 g, 0.50
mmol) was added and the resulting mixture was stirred for 4 h. Water (10
mL) was added, and the product was extracted with hexane/ethyl acetate
(40:1, 3 x 10 mL). The combined organic layer was dried over sodium
sulfate and concentrated under reduced pressure. Silica gel column
purification of the crude oil provided 0.13 g of dodecyl styryl sulfide
(1a, 0.43 mmol, E/Z ) 7:93) in 86% yield. 3-Dodecylthio-3-buten-1-ol
(2c): IR (neat) 3358, 2924, 2853, 2683, 1603, 1466, 1439, 1377, 1148,
1047, 845, 721 cm-1; 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 0.88 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 3H), 1.14-1.46
(m, 18H), 1.56-1.70 (m, 3H), 2.49 (t, J = 6.0 Hz, 2H), 2.71 (t, J = 7.0
Hz, 2H), 3.75-3.83 (m, 2H), 4.80 (s, 1H), 5.11 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ
13.8, 22.3, 27.8, 28.75, 28.83, 29.0, 29.1, 29.2, 29.26, 29.27, 31.0,
31.5, 40.6, 60.9, 107.1, 142.0. Found: C, 70.38; H, 11.60. Calcd for
C16H32OS: C, 70.53; H, 11.84.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM (2S,3R)-S-dodecyl
3-(4-(dimethylamino)phenyl)-3-methoxy-2-methylpropanethioate (9): To a
round-bottom flask containing dodecanethiol (2.70 mL, 11.3 mmol) and a
stir bar was added dry THF (50 mL). The reaction vessel was then stirred
and cooled to 0°C. Upon reaching this temperature, n-butyllithium (1.6 M
in hexanes, 5.91 mL) was added dropwise, such that soln became white and
cloudy. The reaction was allowed to warm to 25°C and stir for 30 min. The
reaction was then cooled to -78°C before imide 8 (1.5 g, 3.78 mmol) was
added dropwise as a soln in dry THF (10 mL). This mixture was allowed to
stir at -78°C for 10 min before warming to 25°C. The reaction was
monitored by TLC for consumption of starting material. After ~ 1 h, the
reaction was quenched with satd ammonium chloride (aq) (20 mL). Satd
sodium bicarbonate (aq) (50 mL) was added, and the reaction mixture was
extracted with methylene chloride (3 × 20 mL). The organic phases were
combined and dried over sodium sulfate. Solvent was removed in vacuo to
provide the crude product. The crude material was purified via flash
chromatography (100% hexanes → 20% EtOAc/hexanes; silica) to give 9 (1.58
g, 99%) as a pale yellow oil: (2S,3R)-S-dodecyl
3-(4-(dimethylamino)phenyl)-3-methoxy-2-methylpropanethioate, yield (1.58
g, 99%) [α]D20 = +72.0° (c = 1.04, CHCl3); 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.17
(d, J = 8.7 Hz, 2H), 6.72 (d, J = 9.0 Hz, 2H), 4.22 (d, J = 9.9 Hz, 1H),
3.11 (s, 3H), 2.97 (s, 6H), 2.93 (m, 3H), 1.61 (m, 2H), 1.27- 1.41 (m,
18H), 0.89 (t, J = 6.6 Hz, 3H), 0.86 (d, J = 4.8 Hz, 3H); 13C NMR (125
MHz, CDCl3) δ 203.1, 150.7, 128.7, 126.6, 112.4, 85.8, 56.7, 55.5, 40.7,
32.1, 29.9, 29.8, 29.8, 29.7, 29.6, 29.4, 29.0, 22.9, 15.6, 14.3; IR
(neat) 2925, 2854, 2818, 1690, 1614, 1523, 1455, 1351, 1096, 974, 946,
816 cm-1; HRMS for C25H42NSO2 [M-H]- calcd 420.2931, found 420.2931
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of 4-Methyldienoates Using a Vinylogous Horner-Wadsworth-Emmons
Reagent. Application to the Synthesis of Trichostatic Acid
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 6-(tert-Butyldithio)hexanol ( 16 ) To a solution of 15 (7.50 g, 33.5
mmol) in methanol (100 ml) was added 2-methyl-2-propanethiol (15.1 ml,
134 mmol), and the mixture was stirred for 6 h at room temperature under
argon atmosphere and concentrated. Silica gel column chromatography (1:5
ethyl acetate-hexane). The residue gave 16 (7.32 g, 99%). 1H NMR (400
MHz, CDCl3): δ 1.33 (s, 9H, S tBu), 1.34- 1.42 (m, 4H, CH22 CH2SS), 1.58
(m, 2H, HOCH2 CH2 ), 1.67 (m, 2H, HOCH2CH2 CH2 ), 2.70 (t, 2H, CH2 SS),
3.64 (t, 2H, HOCH2 ). 13C NMR (100 MHz; CDCl3): δ 25.4, 28.3, 29.2, 29.9,
32.6, 40.8, 47.7, 62.9.

$DATUM Step 2: The mixture of 4-chloronicotinaldehyde 2 (4.6 g, 32.6 mmol),
2-methyl-2-propanethiol (4.4 mL, 32.6 mmol), K2CO3 (9.0 g, 65.2 mmol) and
DMF (70 5 mL) was stirred at 100°C for 12 hrs until TLC indicate no
4-chloronicotinaldehyde was existed. The reaction mixture was diluted
with water, extracted with ethyl acetate and the organic layer was
concentrated. The residue was purified by column chromatography (PE:EA =
12:1) to afford 6.3 g clear oil, yield 99%. 4-(tert-butylthio)
nicotinaldehyde, yield 6.3 g, 99%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): 10.63 (s,
1H), 9.03 (s, 1H), 8.65 (d, 1H), 7.50 (d, 1H), 1.40 (s, 9H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis and characterization of Pd(DiPPF)(StBu)(C6H4-4-Me) (20a). A
solution of 9.2 mg (0.015 mmol) of Pd(DiPPF)(OH)(C6H4-4-Me) (19) and
1,3,5-trioxane (internal standard) in 0.5 mL of THF-d8 was placed into an
NMR tube with a septum-lined screw-cap. A 1H NMR spectrum was recorded.
The sample was cooled to - 20°C, and 1.8 μL (0.016 mmol) of
2-methyl-2-propanethiol were added. The sample was quickly placed into a
precooled NMR spectrometer probe at -20°C. The palladium thiolate complex
20a was formed in 99% yield and characterized by NMR spectroscopy at this
temperature. Pd(DiPPF)(StBu)(C6H4-4-Me) (20a), yield 99%. 1H NMR
(THF-d8): 7.49 (virtual t, J = 7.1 Hz, 2H), 6.76 (d, J = 7.1 Hz, 2H),
4.43 (s, 6H), 4.40 (s, 2H), 3.00 (m, 2H), 2.39 (m, 2H), 2.19 (s, 3H),
1.56 (dd, J = 15.2, 7.3 Hz, 8H), 1.17 (dd, J = 12.2, 6.6 Hz, 8H), 1.03
(dd, J = 13.9, 6.4 Hz, 8H), 0.95 (s, 9H). 31P{1H} NMR (THF-d8): δ 27.7
(d, J = 28.9 Hz), 24.6 (d, J = 29.1 Hz).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 3a. Procedure for Hf(OTf)4-Catalyzed
Thioacetalization: A mixture of carbonyl compounds (aldehydes or ketones,
1a-v, 1.0 mmol), monothiols (ethanethiol or benzenethiol, 2a-2b, 2.0
mmol) or dithiols (1,2-ethanedithiol or 1,3-propanedithiol, 2c-2d, 1.0
mmol), and a small catalytic amount of hafnium trifluoromethanesulfonate
(Hf(OTf)4, 0.8 mg, 0.001 mmol) in dichloromethane (CH2Cl2, 2 mL) was
stirred at room temperature for 5-240 min. After which the mixture was
filtered through Celite and concentrated under reduced pressure. The
residue was purified by flash column chromatography on silica gel to
afford the corresponding thioacetals 3a-y in high yields.
4-(Bis(ethylthio)methyl)phenol (3n): 99% Yield; pale yellow foam; 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.31 (d, 2H, J = 8.7 Hz), 6.77 (d, 2H, J = 8.7 Hz),
5.34 (s, br, 1H), 4.90 (s, 1H), 2.65-2.45 (m, 4H), 1.21 (t, 6H, J = 7.4
Hz); 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3) δ 155.0, 132.5, 129.0, 115.3, 51.8, 26.2,
14.2; FTIR (film) 3356, 2964, 2924, 2867, 1609, 1594, 1508, 1440, 1373,
1312, 1261, 1209, 1167, 1099, 1051, 972, 853, 840, 773, 745, 700 cm-1; MS
228 (M+), 167; HRMS (TOF MS ES-) m/z: Calcd for C11H15OS2 [M-H]-:
227.0564. Found: 227.0555.

$DATUM 75-66-1
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1360556-58-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-614-CAS-26852774
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 99
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 6674-22-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Benzyl 7-((tert-butylthio)carbonyl)bicyclo[3.2.0]heptane-6-carboxylate
(Table 3, entry 5): In a 1.5 dram vial was placed 51.2 mg (0.1023 mmol)
of the imidazolium triflate salt in 1.5 mL dichloromethane. The vial was
sealed with a septum and flushed with a nitrogen atmosphere. 50 μL (0.33
mmol, 3.5 equiv) of DBU were added and let stir for several minutes
before addition of 0.150 mL (1.33 mmol, 13 equiv) tert-butylthiol. After
3.5 h, the reaction was concentrated in vacuo and purified by column
chromatography (10:1 Hex:EtOAc). 35.1 mg (0.101 mmol, 88% yield, >10:1
d.r.) of a clear oil. IR (thin film) 3629, 3093, 2262, 1634 cm-1; 1H NMR:
(500.2 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.33 (m, 5H), 5.12 (m, 2H), 3.66 (dd, J = 10.1, 8.7

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: S-(tert-butyl)
(2S)-2-[(tert-butoxycarbonyl)amino]-3-phenylpropanethioate (1a) Method A:
To a flame-dried round bottom Schlenck flask filled and evacuated with
N2, was added under a cross current of N2, tBoc-AA-OH (3.77 mmol, 1
equiv). The amino acid was dissolved in dry THF (5 mL) and CDI (0.672 g,
4.146 mmol, 1.1 equiv) was added in portions to the flask under a
cross-current of N2. The thiol (11.31 mmol, 3 equiv) was then added and
the reaction was allowed to stir overnight at r.t. The reaction was
controlled via TLC using 100 % DCM as eluent. Once the reaction was
determined finished, 4 N NaOH (10 mL) was added and immediately extracted
with DCM (4 x 7 mL). The organic phases were then combined and dried over
MgSO4, the solvent removed in vacuo and purified over silica gel using
100 % DCM as eluent to give the thioesters as white solids in 65-99 %
yield. S-(tert-butyl)
(2S)-2-[(tert-butoxycarbonyl)amino]-3-phenylpropanethioate (1a)
S-Isopropyl (2S)-2-[(tert-butoxycarbonyl)amino]-3-phenylpropanethioate
(1b) Using method A, the product was obtained as a white solid in a 1.219
g (99 %) yield. 1H-NMR: (300.1 MHz, CDCl3) δ [ppm]: 1.28 (d, J = 6.73 Hz,
3H, CH, CH-1), 1.40 (s, 9H, CH-12), 2.96-3.18 (m, 2H, CH-5), 2.96-3.17
(m, 2H, CH-5), 3.61 (septuplet, J = 6.81 Hz, 1H, CH-2), 4.51-5.65 (m, 1H,
CH-4), 5.00 (d, J = 8.23 Hz, NH), 7.11-7.18 (m, 1H, CH-9), 7.19-7.32 (m,
2H, CH-8,9). 13C-NMR: (75.5 MHz, CDCl3) δ [ppm]: 22.8 (C-1), 28.2 (C-11),
34.7 (C-2), 38.4 (C-5), 61.0 (C-4), 80.2 (C-11),127.0 (C-9), 128.5 (C-7),
129.3 (C-8), 135.8 (C-6), 155.0 (C-10), 200.9 (C-3). HRMS (ESI-TOF): m/z
calcd for C17H26NO3S, 324.1628 [M+ H]+. Found, 324.1629 [M+ H]+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Fmoc-based synthesis of peptide thioesters for native chemical ligation
employing a tert-butyl thiol linker
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Raz, Richard; Rademann, Jorg
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2011), 13(7), 1606-1609

$DATUM S-i-Propyl (2S)-2-[(t-butoxycarbonyl)amino]-3-phenylpropanethioate (5):
General protocol for t-Boc-thioester synthesis for solution stability
tests: Method A: To a flame-dried round bottom Schlenck flask filled and
evacuated with N2, was added under a cross current of N2, t-Boc-AA-OH
(3.77 mmol, 1 equiv.). The amino acid was dissolved in dry THF (5 mL) and
CDI (0.672 g, 4.146 mmol, 1.1 equiv.) was added in portions to the flask
under a cross-current of N2. The thiol (11.31 mmol, 3 equiv.) was then
added and the reaction was allowed to stir overnight at rt. The reaction
was controlled via TLC using 100 % DCM as eluent. Once the reaction was
determined finished, 4 N NaOH (10 mL) was added and immediately extracted
with DCM (4 x 7 mL). The organic phases were then combined and dried over
MgSO4, the solvent removed in vacuo and purified over silica gel using
100 % DCM as eluent to give the thioesters as white solids in 65-99 %
yield. Using method A, the product was obtained as a white solid in a
1.219 g (99 %) yield.

$DATUM O-tert-Butylcarbamoyl-11-octadecylthio-10,11-dihydroquinine. 13
O-tert-Butylcarbamoylquinine (6.941 g, 16.4 mmol), octadecan-1-thiol
(8.755 g, 30.6 mmol), and AIBN (0.275 g, 1.7 mmol) in CHCl3 (35 mL) were
heated at reflux for 24 h. The solution was concentrated in vacuo and the
product purified by column chromatography (silica/CHCl3). The product was
eluted as the second fraction with CHCl3/MeOH (8:2) as the eluent. Yield
11.542 g (16.3 mmol) 99%. Spectral data were in accord with the
literature.13
